If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [ ] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

I think it is better to change the function name of parseHTML to parseSFC for avoiding misunderstanding

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Change iframe src more than once ,  will not back to previous page" (#1917) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsbin.com/hikorawipa/edit?html,output](http://jsbin.com/hikorawipa/edit?html,output)

### Steps to reproduce
- Home to Iframe
- Click Bootstrap, loaded
- Click Vue, loaded
- Click Back button(go(-1)), will not back to Home, but the Bootstrap

![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11537595/33467812-37895d76-d692-11e7-8f17-b0a9374198cb.gif)


### What is expected?
Do not push iframe history into router

### What is actually happening?
If change iframe src more than once (loaded),  then `go(-1)` will not back to previous page

---
- find in v2.2.0, v3.0.1 too
- Chrome 62.0.3202.94

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "在route上面增加isEventChange属性判断是否是事件改变的路由还是调用方法改变的路由" (#1916) at vuejs/vue-router
Closed issue "Dynamic import splits code but doesn't lazy load" (#1915) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/folmert/vue-lazy-loading](https://github.com/folmert/vue-lazy-loading)

### Steps to reproduce
1. `npm install`
2. `npm run start`
3. open app with Network tab in Chrome, refresh if requests are not there
4. all bundles are loaded up front (moin.bundle.js, hello.bundle.js, bye.bundle.js) while only 1 is needed

### What is expected?
Lazy loaded bundles (moin.bundle.js and bye.bundle.js) shouldn't be loaded on initial page load.

### What is actually happening?
Bundles which were supposed to be lazy loaded are loaded up front on initial page load (moin.bundle.js and bye.bundle.js).

---
Following guide was used for introducing lazy loading into router:
https://router.vuejs.org/en/advanced/lazy-loading.html

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
